intro: Microlicia oblongifolia var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elongated, oval-shaped leaves that are pale green in color, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are borne on slender pedicels. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks.
